=== Current Issues ===

The ps2 external mouse input is broken. (Could be bug #38031?)

Dapper Beta 2 live installer: It's all kinda working, but there is something fishy about the DRI (bugs <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/23015|23015]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/41340|41340]]</nowiki>) and hibernation (bugs <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/36944|36944]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/43007|43007]]</nowiki> , <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/35410|35410]]</nowiki>).

Gutsy: Must specify <code>Option "BusType" "PCI"</code> in /etc/X11/xorg.conf to avoid DRI hangs after hibernation.

==== Notes ====
Breezy Badger install went perfectly.
* 1 Screen goes blank, but the backlight is not turned off.
* 2 Screen goes black and is password locked.
* 3 Tested with D-Link DWL-122 Wireless USB adapter.
* 3b Tested with a D-Link DWL-G650 PCMCIA wireless card.
* 4 Tested with the proprietary Connexant hsfmodem drivers.
* 5 DMA is not enabled by default, but can safely be.
* 6 The user is asked during installation to choose modes, but the proposed modes will work.
* 7 Sleep button works, but resume crashes.
* 8 Works after adding synaptics section to xorg.conf
===== Updates =====
Sleep and hibernation worked with Colony-5 (clean install). After apt-get update on 2005-10-01, sleep and hibernate were broken :( Still broken in Breezy RC and Final.

These regressions in Flight-6 have been fixed in Dapper Beta 2 live installer:
* text consoles stay black after resume <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/38500|#38500]]</nowiki>
* installer asks for screen resolutions
* floppy module not loaded (not laptop specific, bug <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/32599|#32599]]</nowiki>)
* keyboard layout becomes wrong if chosen in boot menu F3 (not laptop specific, bug <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/31661|#31661]]</nowiki>)
